title: Donald Dewar
summary: Donald Campbell Dewar (21 August 1937 â€“ 11 October 2000) was a Scottish politician who served as inaugural First Minister of Scotland and Leader of the Scottish Labour Party from 1999 until his death in 2000. He previously served as Secretary of State for Scotland from 1997 to 1999. He was Member of Parliament (MP) for Glasgow Anniesland (formerly Glasgow Garscadden) from 1978 to 2000.[1] Dewar was also Member of the Scottish Parliament (MSP) for the equivalent seat from 1999 to 2000.[2]
